alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 9:21AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS TO CONTINUE ACROSS THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND KNIK RIVER VALLEY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... A strong autumn storm system over Southwest Alaska will continue to produce gusty southeasterly winds through Turnagain Arm, the Knik River Valley, and across the Anchorage Bowl Saturday morning through Sunday morning. The strongest winds and gusts are expected through late morning and again late this afternoon through late Saturday evening. For Turnagain Arm and the Anchorage Hillside, sustained winds of 20 to 25 mph with wind gusts of 40 to 55 mph expected. For the Anchorage Bowl, Eagle River, and the Knik River Valley, sustained winds of 15 to 20 mph with winds gusts of 30 to 45 mph are expected. The strongest wind gusts for these areas will likely occur across South and West Anchorage, the S-curves of the Glenn Highway near Eagle River, and from the Palmer Airport south to the junction of the Parks and Glenn Highways. People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of power outages. Use caution if you must drive, especially if in a high profile vehicle. For more information from the National Weather Service visit https://weather.gov/afc
